"Book after book, year after year, [Koontz] climbs to the top of the charts. 
Why? His readers know: because he is a master storyteller and a daring 
writer, and because in his novels, he gives readers bright hope in a dark 
world."
?Publishers Weekly

Odd Thomas always lives between two worlds in the small town of Pico 
Mundo, where the heroic and the harrowing are everyday events. Odd never 
asked to communicate with the dead?it&#039;s something that just happened. But 
as the unofficial goodwill ambassador between our world and theirs, he&#039;s got 
a duty to do the right thing. That&#039;s the way Odd sees it and that&#039;s why he&#039;s 
won hearts on both sides of the divide between life and death.

Now a childhood friend of Odd&#039;s has disappeared. The worst is feared. But as 
Odd applies his unique talents to the task of finding the missing person, he 
discovers something worse than a dead body, encounters an enemy of 
exceptional cunning, and spirals into a vortex of terror.

Whether you&#039;re meeting Odd Thomas for the first time or he&#039;s already an old 
friend, you&#039;ll be led on an unforgettable journey through a world of terror, 
wonder and delight?to a revelation that can change your life. And you can 
have no better guide than Odd Thomas.

----

Dean Koontz, the author of many #1 New York Times bestsellers, lives with 
his wife, Gerda, and their dog, Trixie, in southern California.

----

David Aaron Baker has appeared on Broadway in A Raisin In The Sun, Once 
Upon A Mattress, The Rainmaker, and Abe Lincoln In Illinois. Film and 
television credits include Lasse HallstrÃƒÂ¶m&#039;s The Hoax, Woody Allen&#039;s Melinda 
and Melinda, Kissing Jessica Stein, The Tao of Steve, The Music Man, Law & 
Order, Third Watch, Sex and the City, and The Practice. He has recorded a 
number of audio books for Random House.
